messages.content: Don't make assumptions about what values to plug into functions. Ask for clarification if a user request is ambiguous.

I'd be happy to help figure out where you are, but I need your location coordinates to use the location search function. Could you provide me with your current latitude and longitude? You can usually find these in your phone's location settings or mapping apps.

No problem—without your latitude and longitude, I can’t pinpoint your exact spot with the tool I have access to. What you can do:

- Open a maps app on your phone (Google Maps, Apple Maps, etc.) and tap the blue dot that shows your current location; that will display your coordinates in decimal form (like 40.7484° N, 73.9857° W).  
- Or simply drop a pin on the map—each platform will show the lat/lon when you look at the pin’s details.

Once you have those two numbers, let me know and I’ll tell you what location information I can pull up.
How can I check those on an iPhone?

Here are two quick ways to get your current latitude and longitude on an iPhone:

1. Via the Compass app  
   • Open the built-in **Compass** app.  
   • At the bottom of the screen you’ll see your **current latitude and longitude** in decimal format (e.g., 37.7749 –122.4194).  
   • Note the two numbers—that’s all I need.

2. Via Apple Maps (if you don’t see Compass or prefer Maps)  
   • Open **Maps** and tap the blue location dot.  
   • Swipe up on the panel that appears; at the bottom you’ll see **“Lat”** and **“Long”** with their numerical values.

Give me whichever two numbers you see, and I can look up the details for you.
Alright, I'll check and let you know.
Perfect—just reply when you have those two numbers (latitude and longitude) and I’ll take care of the rest!
Got it, I'll get back to you.
Sounds good—whenever you're ready, just drop the latitude and longitude and I'll pull up the details for you.
